headline: Citizens downplays interest in participating in M&A boom
summary: Amid a surge in bank mergers, Citizens CEO Bruce Van Saun said the Providence, Rhode Island-based bank is largely focused on organic growth. "It would have to be a pretty high bar for us to go down that path," he said.

raw.headline: Citizens downplays interest in participating in M&A boom

headline: Regional bank stocks mixed on earnings, Apple to use M5 chip
summary: Market Catalysts host Julie Hyman tracks several of the day's top trending stock tickers, including regional banks Citizens Financial Group (CFG), First Horizon (FHN), and PNC Financial Services (PNC) after reporting their quarterly earnings results; Apple (AAPL) updating products with its new M5 chip; and Abbott Laboratories (ABT) cutting its 2025 guidance. To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Market Catalysts.

headline: Citizens Financial Group’s (NYSE:CFG) Q3 Sales Beat Estimates
summary: Regional banking company Citizens Financial Group (NYSE:CFG) beat Wall Street’s revenue expectations in Q3 CY2025, with sales up 11.4% year on year to $2.12 billion. Its GAAP profit of $1.05 per share was 2.3% above analysts’ consensus estimates.

headline: Citizens Financial Group, Inc. Reports Third Quarter 2025 Net Income of $494 million and EPS of $1.05
summary: PROVIDENCE, R.I., October 15, 2025--Citizens Financial Group, Inc. (NYSE: CFG or "Citizens") today reported third quarter financial results. The earnings press release, investor presentation, and financial supplement are available at http://investor.citizensbank.com. In addition, these materials will be furnished to the Securities and Exchange Commission (SEC) on a Form 8-K and will be available on the SEC website at www.sec.gov.
